title: EnerStar Solutions announces third Starlink enterprise reseller deal
summary: Canada-based EnerStar Solutions, a rental company for the energy sector, said Oct. 3 it has reached a deal to add SpaceX’s Starlink broadband to the services it provides industrial workers.

title: Redwire back on acquisition trail with deal for QinetiQ Space
summary: British defense firm Qinetiq is selling its Belgian commercial satellite systems division to Redwire, a U.S.-based consolidator of space infrastructure.

title: SpaceX preparing for launch of 52 Starlink satellites from Vandenberg
summary: SpaceX’s Falcon 9 B1071-5 is ready to launch 52 Starlink satellites from Space Launch Complex 4 East (SLC-4E) at Vandenberg Space Force Base, in California. The Starlink 4-29 mission has a targeted T0 at 4:56 PM PDT (23:56 UTC) on Monday, Oct. 3 with an instantaneous launch window.

title: Atlas 5 rocket rolls launch pad at Cape Canaveral with two SES comsats
summary: United Launch Alliance hauled an Atlas 5 rocket to its launch pad Monday at Cape Canaveral on the eve of a planned blastoff with two commercial television broadcasting satellites for SES, owner of one of the largest fleets of geostationary communications spacecraft.

title: After an amazing run at Mars, India says its orbiter has no more fuel
summary: The orbiter most definitely exceeded expectations.

title: Viasat sells tactical data communications business to L3Harris for $1.96 billion
summary: L3Harris Technologies has agreed to acquire Viasat’s tactical data link business for $1.96 billion, the companies announced Oct. 3.

title: With orbital launch, Firefly takes an early lead in the 1-ton rocket race
summary: "Firefly is at the point where the only thing holding them back is execution."

title: Crew dress rehearsal, rocket test-firing complete at SpaceX launch pad
summary: SpaceX teams and the four crew members set for blastoff this week to the International Space Station completed dress rehearsals Sunday at NASA’s Kennedy Space Center in Florida, familiarizing the astronauts with their launch day checklist and testing out the Falcon 9 rocket that will carry them into orbit.

title: Amid Starship milestones, Booster 7 set to return for pre-launch testing
summary: SpaceX’s Starship program continues to march through a fluid set of milestones, ranging from a new record number of Raptor engines firing simultaneously, to the anticipated presence of a vehicle on the Starship pad at Florida’s historic LC-39A by the second quarter of 2023.

title: NASA pushes back Artemis 1 launch to November
summary: NASA will wait until at least the middle of November before attempting another launch of the Space Launch System on the Artemis 1 mission, citing the impacts from Hurricane Ian.
